questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a file signature?

answers.a: To provide a unique identifier for a file type
answers.b: To encrypt the contents of a file

explanations.a: File signatures are sequences of bytes that uniquely identify a file type.
explanations.b: File signatures do not encrypt files; they only identify file types.
explanations.c: File signatures do not alter the size of a file.
explanations.d: File signatures are unrelated to compression.

questions.question: Which of the following file types is commonly identified by its file signature?

explanations.a: Text files do not have a specific file signature.
explanations.b: JPG files are identified by their distinct file signature.
explanations.c: MP3 files have a different signature but are not the most common example.
explanations.d: Executable files also have a signature, but JPG is more commonly discussed in introductory contexts.

questions.question: In the context of file carving, what is the first step you should take when attempting to extract a file?

answers.a: Open the file in a text editor

explanations.a: Opening the file in a text editor is not the first step for carving.
explanations.b: Identifying the file signature is crucial to begin file carving.
explanations.c: Compression is not part of the initial carving process.
explanations.d: While important, an antivirus scan is not the first step in file carving.

questions.question: What is another common name for a file signature?

explanations.a: The footer is at the end of a file, not the beginning.
explanations.b: The file extension is not the same as the signature.
explanations.c: Correct. File signatures are often referred to as magic numbers.
explanations.d: The file path indicates location, not file type.

questions.question: Where is the file signature usually found within a file?

answers.a: At the end of the file
answers.b: In the middle of the file
answers.c: At the beginning of the file

explanations.a: File signatures are not stored at the end of the file.
explanations.b: They are not found in the middle of the file.
explanations.c: Correct. File signatures are located at the beginning of the file.
explanations.d: They follow a specific pattern, not random placement.

questions.question: Why might file signatures be more reliable than file extensions when identifying file types?

answers.a: They are visible in the filename
answers.b: They can be used to compress files
answers.c: They are embedded in the file’s content

explanations.a: File signatures are not visible in filenames.
explanations.b: They are not used for compression.
explanations.c: Correct. File signatures are embedded in the file’s content and cannot be changed as easily as extensions.
